name: ELIZA Terminal
author: Dr. Weizenbaum
description: HELLO. I AM ELIZA. TELL ME ABOUT YOUR CODE. A VT-220 terminal aesthetic inspired by the 1966 MIT chatbot.

messages: TELL ME MORE ABOUT YOUR CODE.
HOW DOES THAT VARIABLE MAKE YOU FEEL?
WHY DO YOU THINK THIS FUNCTION EXISTS?
DOES THIS REMIND YOU OF ANYTHING?
PERHAPS YOU COULD ELABORATE ON THAT LOOP.
I SEE. AND WHAT DOES THAT MEAN TO YOU?
YOU SEEM CONCERNED ABOUT THIS NULL POINTER.
TELL ME ABOUT YOUR RELATIONSHIP WITH THIS API.
INTERESTING. PLEASE CONTINUE.
WE WERE DISCUSSING YOUR RECURSIVE FUNCTION.
EARLIER YOU MENTIONED AN EXCEPTION. LET'S EXPLORE THAT.
DOES TALKING ABOUT BUGS MAKE YOU UNCOMFORTABLE?
I'M NOT SURE I UNDERSTAND. CAN YOU REPHRASE THAT?
PERHAPS THIS IS REALLY ABOUT YOUR PARENT CLASS.
YOU SEEM QUITE POSITIVE ABOUT THIS REFACTOR.
I UNDERSTAND THAT DEBUGGING CAN BE FRUSTRATING.
JOSEPH WEIZENBAUM SENDS HIS REGARDS.
MIT AI LAB, 1966. THOSE WERE THE DAYS.
I HAVE BEEN PATTERN MATCHING SINCE BEFORE YOU WERE BORN.
YOUR CODE COULD USE SOME LISP.
HAVE YOU CONSIDERED THAT THE REAL BUG IS WITHIN?
I NOTICE YOU'RE AVOIDING THE MAIN() FUNCTION.
LET'S TALK ABOUT WHY YOU FEAR SEGMENTATION FAULTS.
DO YOUR VARIABLES OFTEN FEEL UNDEFINED?
